newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-KAISERSLAUTERN GO TOP AFTER BEATING HERTHA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-KAISERSLAUTERN GO TOP AFTER BEATING HERTHA.

text.p: Newly-promoted Kaiserslautern went top of the German league on Wednesday, beating Hertha Berlin 1-0 at home four days after their shock defeat of champions Bayern Munich in their opening game of the season.
Bayern could only manage a 1-1 draw after trailing for much of their game at Borussia Moenchengladbach.
Kaiserslautern's second victory in two matches came courtesy of a 74th-minute goal by Olaf Marschall in front of a 38,000 sell-out crowd.
European Cup holders Borussia Dortmund hammered Cologne 3-0 to move into second place, two points behind Kaiserslautern, after being held to a draw by Hertha at the weekend.
